perturbation.original_text:
2. DEFINITIONS:

    INITIAL DISTRIBUTION      PERIOD:                    April 15, 2000 through October 15,                                 2000 (6 Months from the Effective Date)

    PRODUCTS:                   The CircuiTest 2000S In-Circuit Test System

                                The CircuiTest 2100 Scanner Expansion

    EXCLUSIVE TERRITORIES:      The 48 Contiguous United States

    EFFECTIVE DATE:             The earlier of the date Comware orders and                                 pays for a minimum of $22,710 worth of                                 Products, in any combination, or April 15, 2000.
perturbation.changed_text:
2. DEFINITIONS:

    INITIAL DISTRIBUTION      PERIOD:                    April 15, 2000 through October 15,                                 2000 (6 Months from the Effective Date)

    PRODUCTS:                   As defined in Exhibit A

    EXCLUSIVE TERRITORIES:      The 48 Contiguous United States

    EFFECTIVE DATE:             The earlier of the date Comware orders and                                 pays for a minimum of $22,710 worth of                                 Products, in any combination, or April 15, 2000.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition of PRODUCTS (The CircuiTest 2000S In-Circuit Test System and The CircuiTest 2100 Scanner Expansion) is replaced with a reference to 'Exhibit A', while Exhibit A does not exist, creating an omission. Later sections referring to 'Products' become ambiguous, as the specific items are no longer defined within the contract itself. This impacts enforceability.

perturbation.original_text:
3. EXCLUSIVE RIGHTS: Upon the effective date of this agreement COMWARE shall have the exclusive right to purchase, at the DISCOUNTS described below, and resell Products to potential customers during the Initial Distribution Period, based on the following terms and conditions:

(a)    COMWARE must purchase no less than $22,710.00 worth of Products, in any        combination,  by April 15, 2000.  This initial order shall be evidenced        by valid  purchase  order from  COMWARE to be  received by ITS no later        than 5:00PM April 1, 2000,  with payment to be received by ITS no later        than April 15,  2000.  In the event  either of these dates are not met,        this Agreement will automatically and immediately terminate and neither        of the parties  hereto will have any  further  obligations,  one to the        other.

(b)    Future  Purchase  Orders  and  delivery  will  approximate  the  15 day        delivery schedule (but not the dates), although payment will be made by        COMWARE to ITS no later than thirty (30) days after  receipt of invoice        from ITS.

(c)    Provided  COMWARE  purchases  the  initial  products  as in (a)  above,        COMWARE  shall have the right to purchase  additional  Products up to a        total of $45,420.00 at the following discounts:

                                       1

     INITIAL DISCOUNTS:

         PRODUCT IDENTIFICATION     SUGGESTED RETAIL PRICE       DISCOUNT        PRICE TO COMWARE -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                                                                                          CircuiTest 2000S           $5,995.00                       45%                 $3,297.25          CircuiTest 2100 Scanner    $2,995.00                       56%                 $1,317.80

        (INTERNATIONAL TEST SYSTEMS RESERVES THE RIGHT TO CHANGE THE RETAIL         PRICE AT ANY TIME, WITH NOTICE TO COMWARE.)

(d)      In the event COMWARE purchases  products in excess of $45,420.00 during          the  Initial  Distribution  Period, COMWARE  shall  have  the  right to          purchase additional Products at the following discounts:

     SUBSEQUENT DISCOUNTS:

         PRODUCT IDENTIFICATION     SUGGESTED RETAIL PRICE       DISCOUNT        PRICE TO COMWARE -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                                                                                          CircuiTest 2000S           $5,995.00                       50%                 $2,997.50          CircuiTest 2100 Scanner    $2,995.00                       60%                 $1,198.00

        (INTERNATIONAL TEST SYSTEMS RESERVES THE RIGHT TO CHANGE THE RETAIL         PRICE AT ANY TIME, WITH NOTICE TO COMWARE.)
perturbation.changed_text:
3. EXCLUSIVE RIGHTS: Upon the effective date of this agreement COMWARE shall have the exclusive right to purchase, and resell Products to potential customers during the Initial Distribution Period, based on the following terms and conditions:

(a)    COMWARE must purchase no less than $22,710.00.  This initial order shall be evidenced        by valid  purchase  order from  COMWARE to be  received by ITS no later        than 5:00PM April 1, 2000,  with payment to be received by ITS no later        than April 15,  2000.  In the event  either of these dates are not met,        this Agreement will automatically and immediately terminate and neither        of the parties  hereto will have any  further  obligations,  one to the        other.

(b)    Future  Purchase  Orders  and  delivery  will  approximate  the  15 day        delivery schedule (but not the dates), although payment will be made by        COMWARE to ITS no later than thirty (30) days after  receipt of invoice        from ITS.

(c)    Provided  COMWARE  purchases  the  initial  products  as in (a)  above,        COMWARE  shall have the right to purchase  additional  Products up to a        total of $45,420.00.

(d)      In the event COMWARE purchases  products in excess of $45,420.00 during          the  Initial  Distribution  Period, COMWARE  shall  have  the  right to          purchase additional Products.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the discounts, the exclusive rights of COMWARE to 'purchase, at the DISCOUNTS described below' become undefined. Sections (c) and (d) reference discounted prices ('INITIAL DISCOUNTS', 'SUBSEQUENT DISCOUNTS') which are now omitted. This creates ambiguity regarding the actual cost of the Products during both the Initial Distribution Period and any Renewal Period. This impacts the economics of the agreement and its enforcement.

perturbation.original_text:
8.   WARRANTY:  ITS  Products  are  warranted  free from  defects of material or      workmanship  for 3 years after  shipment from the  manufacturer.  Equipment      purchased from ITS, which becomes defective within that time period will be      repaired by ITS at its  headquarters  in San  Antonio,  Texas at no cost to      COMWARE  beyond cost of shipping  the  equipment  to ITS. ITS will bear the      cost of returning the item to COMWARE by UPS,  REGULAR  DELIVERY.  priority      shipping costs will be borne by COMWARE.

     This  warranty  is  contingent  upon  proper  use and  installation  of the      Products and does not cover equipment which has been modified  without ITS'      consent or which has been  subjected  to  unusual  physical  or  electrical      stress or on which the original  identification  marks have been removed or      altered.
perturbation.changed_text:
8.   WARRANTY:  ITS  Products  are  warranted according to the warranty guidelines in Appendix B.  Equipment      purchased from ITS, which becomes defective will be addressed according to Appendix B.

     This  warranty  is  contingent  upon  proper  use and  installation  of the      Products and does not cover equipment which has been modified  without ITS'      consent or which has been  subjected  to  unusual  physical  or  electrical      stress or on which the original  identification  marks have been removed or      altered.
perturbation.explanation: The original warranty details (3 years, repair location, shipping costs) are replaced with a reference to 'Appendix B', a non-existent document. While a warranty is mentioned, the specifics are absent, making it unenforceable. The sentence stating the original terms is replaced with a sentence stating that defective equipment will be addressed according to Appendix B, creating an omission. The contract refers to the warranty but the critical terms of the warranty are not in the contract.
